intro: Bonnaya veronicifolia, commonly known as the sacred lotus of Java, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in a variety of colors. The plant has a thick, fleshy stem and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in wet, swampy environments and is often found in marshy areas near rivers. The plant has cultural and medicinal significance in traditional Indonesian practices.
